title: Remove Duplicates
description: Create an array with duplicate values removed
instructions:
Write a function `removeDuplicates(arr)` that takes an array and returns a new array with all duplicate values removed (keeping only the first occurrence of each value).

Example: removeDuplicates([1, 2, 2, 3, 4, 4, 5]) should return [1, 2, 3, 4, 5]

hints.content: Build a new array by only adding elements that aren't already in your result array.
Create an empty array for unique values. Loop through the original array and check if each element already exists in your unique array using .includes(). Only push if it doesn't exist.
Use `const unique = [];`. Loop: `for (let i = 0; i < arr.length; i++)`. Check with `if (!unique.includes(arr[i]))` then `unique.push(arr[i])`.

learningObjectives: Using array.includes() to check for existence
